name: Global Carbon Project
Our World in Data based on the Global Carbon Project
Our World in Data based on the Global Carbon Project
description:
{"link": "https://folk.universitetetioslo.no/roberan/GCB2020.shtml", "retrievedDate": "14-September-2021", "additionalInfo": "The Global Carbon Budget dataset is available at https://folk.universitetetioslo.no/roberan/GCB2020.shtml (1750-2019) and https://doi.org/10.18160/GCP-2020 (1959-2019).

Full reference for the Global Carbon Budget - Global Carbon Project (2020) dataset: Friedlingstein et al, Global Carbon Budget 2020, Earth Syst. Sci. Data, 12, 3269–3340, https://doi.org/10.5194/essd-12-3269-2020, 2020.

Our World in Data have renamed the category "bunker fuels" as "International transport" for improved clarity, which includes emissions from international aviation and shipping.

Population figures are sourced from Gapminder (v6), HYDE (2016) and United Nations Population Division (2019). Links: https://www.gapminder.org/data/documentation/gd003/; https://population.un.org/wpp/Download/Standard/Population/; https://www.pbl.nl/en/image/links/hyde", "dataPublishedBy": "Our World in Data based on the Global Carbon Project", "dataPublisherSource": "Friedlingstein et al. (2020)"}

name: Our World in Data based on the Global Carbon Project, BP and Shift Energy Data Portal
description:
{"link": "https://folk.universitetetioslo.no/roberan/GCB2020.shtml", "retrievedDate": "14-September-2021", "additionalInfo": "The Global Carbon Budget dataset is available at https://folk.universitetetioslo.no/roberan/GCB2020.shtml (1750-2019) and https://doi.org/10.18160/GCP-2020 (1959-2019).

Full reference for the Global Carbon Budget - Global Carbon Project (2020) dataset: Friedlingstein et al, Global Carbon Budget 2020, Earth Syst. Sci. Data, 12, 3269–3340, https://doi.org/10.5194/essd-12-3269-2020, 2020.

Our World in Data have renamed the category "bunker fuels" as "International transport" for improved clarity, which includes emissions from international aviation and shipping.

Primary energy consumption figures are sourced from BP and Shift Energy Data Portal. Link: https://www.bp.com/en/global/corporate/energy-economics/statistical-review-of-world-energy, https://www.theshiftdataportal.org/energy", "dataPublishedBy": "Our World in Data based on the Global Carbon Project, BP and Shift Energy Data Portal", "dataPublisherSource": "Friedlingstein et al. name: Global Carbon Project
description:
{"link": "https://folk.universitetetioslo.no/roberan/GCB2020.shtml", "retrievedDate": "14-September-2021", "additionalInfo": "The Global Carbon Budget dataset is available at https://folk.universitetetioslo.no/roberan/GCB2020.shtml (1750-2019) and https://doi.org/10.18160/GCP-2020 (1959-2019).

Full reference for the Global Carbon Budget - Global Carbon Project (2020) dataset: Friedlingstein et al, Global Carbon Budget 2020, Earth Syst. Sci. Data, 12, 3269–3340, https://doi.org/10.5194/essd-12-3269-2020, 2020.

Our World in Data have renamed the category "bunker fuels" as "International transport" for improved clarity, which includes emissions from international aviation and shipping.

Consumption-based CO2 emissions have been constructed by the Global Carbon Project using the methodology described in:

Peters, GP, Minx, JC, Weber, CL and Edenhofer, O 2011. Growth in emission transfers via international trade from 1990 to 2008. Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences 108, 8903-8908. http://www.pnas.org/content/108/21/8903.abstract", "dataPublishedBy": "Global Carbon Budget - Global Carbon Project (2020)", "dataPublisherSource": "Friedlingstein et al. (2020)"}

(2020)"}
